scenario: Plug Power's stock price dropped 7.1% after the US Department of Energy approved a $1.7 billion loan guarantee to support the company's expansion of domestic manufacturing and hydrogen production capabilities. The loan will fund up to six projects to produce and liquify zero- or low-carbon hydrogen at scale throughout the US. This is expected to triple the company's hydrogen fuel output to 135 tons per day. However, the company already has nearly $930 million in debt and is burning $1.3 billion in cash annually, with annual losses of $1.4 billion. The company's 28-year history of losses and increasing debt makes it a sell.
